description: gospel +‎ -er (occupational suffix). Compare Middle English gospeler (“one of the Gospel writers or Evangelists; statue of one of the Evangelists; (of Old Testament persons) bringer of good news; Isaiah; book containing the Gospels; content of one of the Gospels”), from Old English godspellere.

entries.meaning: A person who preaches from the Gospels
(obsolete, Early Modern) A Protestant or evangelical Christian.
